remarks: Two ways of saying a group homomorphism is 1-1-onto its image. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 3-Mar-2008.)
statement:
ghomf1olem.1 $e |- X = ran G $.
ghomf1olem.2 $e |- Y = ran F $.
ghomf1olem.3 $e |- S = ( H |` ( Y X. Y ) ) $.
ghomf1olem.4 $e |- Z = ran S $.
ghomf1olem.5 $e |- U = ( GId ` G ) $.
ghomf1olem.6 $e |- T = ( GId ` H ) $.
ghomf1o $p |- ( ( G e. GrpOp /\ H e. GrpOp /\ F e. ( G GrpOpHom H ) ) -> ( F : X -1-1-onto-> Z <-> A. x e. X ( ( F ` x ) = T -> x = U ) ) ) $.
$d F x $.
$d G x $.
$d H x $.
$d T x $.
$d U x $.
$d X x $.
$d Z x $.
